newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt sends Interpol after escaped Turkish ship.
newsitem.headline: Egypt sends Interpol after escaped Turkish ship.

text.p: The Egyptian security officer guarding an impounded Turkish cargo ship was thrown ovrboard after the vessel sailed from the port of Suez without permission, port officials said on Tuesday.
The officials asked Interpol and Lloyd's Shipping Intelligence Service to track down the bulk carrier Hasan B, which had arrived at the Egyptian port from Saudi Arabia.
It secretly sailed away at dawn on Friday with the Egyptian officer guarding it on board, they said.
The officer was later found hanging to a life buoy off the Red Sea port of Safaga and he said the ship's captain had thrown him overboard, the port officials added.
The port authorities impounded the 15,829 gross tonne vessel because its agent failed to pay more than $200,000 for fuel and provisions the ship had taken on a previous trip.
